title: Vegetable Biryani
description: A fragrant Indian rice dish with mixed vegetables and aromatic spices.

ingredients.name: Mixed Vegetables (Carrots, Peas, Cauliflower, Green Beans)

instructions.text: Soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. Drain, then parboil until 70% cooked.
Sauté onions until golden brown. Set aside half for garnish.
In the same pot, sauté ginger-garlic paste, then add vegetables, biryani masala, and other spices. Cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add yogurt and cook for another 5 minutes until vegetables are partially cooked.
Layer the parboiled rice over the vegetable mixture. Sprinkle with fried onions, mint, and cilantro.
Cover tightly, cook on low heat for 20-25 minutes. Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

title: Mushroom Risotto
description: A creamy Italian rice dish with mushrooms and Parmesan cheese.

instructions.text: Sauté mushrooms in olive oil until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, sauté onion and garlic until soft.
Add rice and stir for 1-2 minutes until translucent at the edges.
Pour in wine (if using) and stir until absorbed.
Add warm broth, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring until absorbed before adding more. Continue until rice is creamy and al dente (about 18-20 minutes).
Stir in mushrooms, butter, and Parmesan. Season to taste. Serve immediately.

title: Spinach and Ricotta Stuffed Shells
description: Pasta shells filled with a creamy spinach and cheese mixture, baked in tomato sauce.

instructions.text: Cook pasta shells according to package directions. Drain and cool.
Mix ricotta, spinach, half the mozzarella, Parmesan, egg, salt, pepper, and Italian herbs.
Spread 1 cup marinara sauce in the bottom of a 9x13 baking dish.
Fill each shell with about 1.5 tablespoons of the cheese mixture. Arrange in the baking dish.
Pour remaining sauce over the shells. Sprinkle with remaining mozzarella.
Cover with foil. Bake at 375°F for 25 minutes. Uncover and bake 5-10 minutes more until cheese is melted and bubbly.

title: Quinoa Buddha Bowl
description: A nutritious bowl with quinoa, roasted vegetables, and tahini dressing.

instructions.text: Cook quinoa according to package directions.
Toss sweet potato and broccoli with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Roast at 400°F for 20-25 minutes until tender.
Drain and rinse chickpeas. Optional: roast with spices for added flavor.
Make dressing by whisking tahini, lemon juice, water, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Assemble bowls by dividing quinoa, roasted vegetables, chickpeas, and sliced avocado.
Drizzle with tahini dressing and sprinkle with optional toppings like seeds or microgreens.

title: Vegetable Pad Thai
description: A plant-based version of the classic Thai noodle dish.

instructions.text: Soak rice noodles in hot water according to package directions until al dente. Drain.
Make sauce by mixing tamarind paste, soy sauce, brown sugar, and lime juice.
Press and cube tofu. Cook in a hot wok or skillet until golden.
Add bell pepper and carrots, stir-fry until just tender.
Push vegetables to one side, add beaten eggs (if using) and scramble.
Add drained noodles and sauce. Toss to coat. Fold in bean sprouts and green onions.
Serve topped with chopped peanuts, cilantro, and lime wedges.
